attributes.action: Introduce a 12-month residency requirement for candidates to Parliament
attributes.background: In order for Parliament to become truly representative, this petition proposes introducing legislation to require persons standing for Parliament to be resident in their constituency for at least 12 months prior to election day.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is meant to be a representative democracy.  However, parties will often choose a favoured member to run for a seat to maximise their chances of winning, even though they have no genuine connection to the local community.  As a result, Parliament is not a collection of community representatives, but a collection of preferred party members.

attributes.action: Stop charging students council tax on property rented for graduating year
attributes.background: Students are exempt from paying council tax however if a student is still living in student accommodation after they’ve graduated, they’re expected to pay the remaining months, even though their finically situation is still the same or most of the time, even worse.
attributes.additional_details: Contracts are only available for 12 months from most letting agents therefor trapping students into a fee that most of them can’t afford or have to pay with their student loan which is supposed to be used to help forward they’re education and living costs. We still have to pay this loan back and being forced to give a large amount of it away for a period of time in which you can’t control is very worrying. The exemption of students paying council tax should last their whole tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Set up a new homes ombudsman to address serious failings in the building sector.
attributes.background: A new independent ombudsman should have powers to impose large fines to the builders of inadequate new build homes. Failing this the builders should offer a refund to the buyers of substandard homes.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal experience of being sold a substandard home. I was advised by the estate agent that a surveyor was unnecessary as my home carried a 10 year warranty. After a couple of months I appointed a Surveyor due to concerns about the inadequate construction of my home, for example, ordered wardrobes to be fitted, unfortunately these couldn’t be fitted due to the sloping of the floors up to 14ml between one wall and the other.

It is is now nearly 12 months since I moved in - there are 112 defects of which 5 are serious.

attributes.action: Make it law that savings interest rates go up same time as loans & mortgages.
attributes.background: This last decade's rock-bottom interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest, because banks are quick to raise rates on loans & mortgages after BoE hikes, but are reluctant to offer the same, timely hikes for savings. Savers see this as immoral an highway robbery on our High Streets.
attributes.additional_details:
Before the 2008 crisis, from 1998 to 2007, savers earned £233 billion in interest. Following it, from 2008 to 2017, they earned just £129 billion because banks fail to pass on rate rises announced by the BoE.
Interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest payments https://dailym.ai/2ot5PJ3 
Millions of savers are being hit by rip-off rates https://dailym.ai/2PzyEin
 
We request that our MP's debate this in Parliament and create a new law that will enforce timely equitable treatment for interest rates on savings and retrospectively make good the deficit.

attributes.action: We believe Wythenshawe Community Initiative deserves more funding
attributes.background: Wythenshawe Community Initiative are a child daycare centre that provide a safe space for children to play and be looked after, whilst parents are working. Everyday they have children and parents lining up to get a place in however many are turned away due to lack of funding and staff.
attributes.additional_details:
They are a non-profit organisation, based in Manchester and are for children from the ages of five to eleven. 

In 2017 they fundraised £3,498.52 but this is nowhere near enough to support the centre. Many children who turn up at the centre go without breakfast and staff struggle to provide them with enough food due to the lack of money.

attributes.action: Do not endorse Zimbabwe’s harmonised 2018 elections
attributes.background: There is growing evidence that the outcome of Zimbabwe’s harmonised elections was not a result of a free and fair electoral process. This was followed by post-election violence and the alleged slaughter and beatings of civilians by the army.
attributes.additional_details:
Abductions and an intensified crackdown on the opposition is ongoing.

As an activist, and with many Zimbabweans I am appealing to the UK parliament and government to: - suspend further economic, bilateral engagement with Zimbabwe's govt until there is clarity on its human rights situation; -recognise the unsafe political environment in Zimbabwe for opposition and activists; -strongly support concerns raised by EU, Zimbabwe Human Rights Groups and the USA on elections in Zimbabwe; put pressure on Zimbabwe's govt to account for the killing of innocent civilians by the army.

attributes.action: Sexual Assault law must not focus on perpetrator perception
attributes.background: In court a perpetrator may say "it was my perception she consented" and he/she will face no consequence for his actions. Informed consent should be written in law. Consent must be verbalised every time, and can be withdrawn at any time, with no punitive consequence.
attributes.additional_details: The law must say consent cannot be given by anyone asleep, under the influence of drugs or alcohol being unable to express a view, or those without physical capacity to object whether through temporary or permanent disability or because unconscious. Rape is a violent crime designed to humiliate and break people.

attributes.action: Make overtime tax free
attributes.background: We pay tax on our standard hours so we should get our overtime tax free

attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: All English Local Authorities to notify residents by post of new Consultations
attributes.background: When introducing any legislation affecting residents, The Local Authority/Council must serve notice of any consultation or proposal directly on ALL residents, in additional languages if required, by way of postal service. Local Authorities across England are failing to comply with this requirement
attributes.additional_details: A specific example of this is the introduction of Selective Licensing in Luton, ALL residents in the affected areas have not been informed of the Consultation. The outcome of this consultation will affect all residents of Luton. We are asking for people across England to support this if they have had a similar experience with their Local Authority failing to consult with them on important changes affecting their town/city.

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.

attributes.action: Offer support to Greece regarding the Mati Wildfire Crisis
attributes.background: The Mati wildfire has burned through village, causing 74 fatalities so far, with that number "expected to rise", and with little control over the fire. The United Kingdom should offer assistance in the form of firefighters, aircraft and vehicles to assist the struggling victims of the fire.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.reviewjournal.com/news/nation-and-world/death-toll-from-greece-fires-reaches-74-is-expected-to-rise/amp/

attributes.action: No one can become an MP without having worked 15 years in the workplace.
attributes.background: 'Career' politicians do not have experience of our lives in the UK.  The 'workplace' is defined as any job that is not associated with politics.  EG salaried lobbyists and union representatives would not be able to become MPs unless they had also worked in other professions for 15 years.
attributes.additional_details: Too many current politicians take PPE at university, join lobby or other political organisations, then seek a parliamentary seat.  Ambition, rather than vocation, is their motivation; this is not in the national interest.  Parliament lacks expertise in industrial, engineering, and practical areas.  Academics are needed too, but most decisions require life experiences that the majority of MPs do not have.  We need you to work for us, not just further your ambitions, and play power games.

attributes.action: Prevent absent parents from travelling outside the UK if maintenance is unpaid
attributes.background: Recently Australia enforced action against parents with child support debts from travelling in and out of the country until they had settled their arrears. Introducing a similar law into the UK would benefit many UK families and make absent parents face up to their responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/may/27/child-support-debts-record-number-of-parents-prevented-from-travelling-overseas

attributes.action: Ban Staples From Newspapers
attributes.background: Staples are an unnecessary addition to newspapers which are an environmental liability - this petition asks the government to ban the use of staples in newspaper production.
attributes.additional_details:
Staples are for the most part made using steel which is produced with the requirement of a blast furnace and this using large amounts of energy. No staples would also mean that newspapers would be more easily recyclable due to the absence of metal and the decay of newspapers would be much increased.
Banning staples would bring down production costs for newspaper companies And would create a safer environment in factories.

attributes.action: Introduce retesting every ten years for drivers/driving license.
attributes.background: Every driver falls into bad habits or are not up to date with the current rules of the road, after driving for years. They put themselves, and others at risk. If we introduce that every driver must re-take their test every ten years, more drivers would be better informed of the rules of the road.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also create more jobs, eg more driving teachers/testers. Every ten years when it’s time to re-take your driving test, the first retake would be free, however, if you fail, you must pay the same cost as your first ever tests.

Also if your main job is driving eg delivery trucks, perhaps the re-take test time should be every 5 years.

All in all this would mean more money for the government, safer drivers with drivers being better informed thus making safer roads.

attributes.action: Work with EU to allow promotion/marketing of infant formula milk(under 6months)
attributes.background: Currently you are unable to to gain advantage points from supermarkets and reatailers such as boots on formula milk (for under 6 months) you can also not buy formula with these advantage points. This is due to a law that prevents the promotion or discount of formula milk for under 6 month olds.
attributes.additional_details: the price of formula is regulated as to stop 'formula shopping' and prevent people from buying the cheapest formula they can find, as this enables mother/fathers to use one brand or staggared brands through out infancy- they were finding that babies where becoming really unwell by getting fed different formulas every week. It also prevents supermarkets trying to push formula that is close to expire. But parents should be able to gain advantage points on buying formula milk.

attributes.action: Prohibit the manafacture and commercial distribution of cigarettes within the UK
attributes.background:
Ever hour around the world, 800 people die as a result of the most lethal human creation - cigarettes. These small paper rolls kill more people on average around the globe than AK47's

So why is it so ironic that countries prohibit smoking in public but still allow toxic tobacco manufacturing ?
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 4 million hectares of deforestation for cigarette fuels and paper wrapping.

This industry kills 7 million people ever year

So why can we as humans not recognise that this substance would be better off if completely irradicated. Why is it seen as though the manafacturers care more about their profits than the health of people around the globe. 

And unfortunately, "smoking kills" just isn't enough.

attributes.action: Fine parents who refuse to have regular contact with their children.
attributes.background: Parents who choose not see their children regularly subject them to feelings of abandonment. More action and strict policies should be in place to enforce regular contact. Where possible, children need their both parents.

attributes.action: Compulsory training for all services and organisations on all Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: We would like it to be compulsory for any organisation offering a product, service (whether public or private) or recreational events or activities whether or not publicly accessible to the public to have thorough, frequent, unbiased and accurate awareness training on ALL types of assistance dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a handler of an owner trained assistance dog. Luckily I have only been refused access to a service once, but I know many people have had several access issues despite it being 2019.

I am happy to help with the rollout of this training and personally help to train people and organisations myself.

attributes.action: Create hospital wards for young adults (16-21)
attributes.background: My daughter has a congenital heart defect and has been admitted to hospital many times in since turning 16 as she is no longer classed as a child patient this means she is put on adult wards which are often mixed this is uncomfortable for any young person.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that all hospitals should have wards for young people to help with the transition between child and adult services, I feel that a young person being placed on an adult ward is daunting, stressful, worrying and uncomfortable. Mixing 16-21 year olds girls with men in their 70’s, 80’s & 90’s or vice versa is not ideal! This needs to change

attributes.action: Support the Prime Minister's Brexit Deal
attributes.background: I run a small business and the uncertainty around Brexit is completely unacceptable. There is no deal available that will satisfy everyone and what the PM has negotiated gives a degree of certainty the business community needs. No Deal or leaving on WTO Terms is not an option.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for secondary schools to isolate pupils
attributes.background: Across England, many secondary schools isolate students for hours, days or weeks at a time, this is only detrimental to a students’ mental health but questionably against the human rights of pupils, this is not a punishment but a custodial sentence in some instances
attributes.additional_details: Schools should not be allowed to isolate pupils for more than one hour, the secondary school I attended (till August 2017) this year would isolate students for something as trivial as a short haircut. Isolation is infringing on the liberties of young people across the country and it should not be tolerated, the problem is more widespread than I thought as many schools across the UK use isolation to reprimand students. Segregation does not breed well rounded individuals.

attributes.action: Extend the CAMHS upper age limit to 21
attributes.background: Mental illnesses do not disappear at the age of 18, yet it seems that in the majority of cases, once they turn 18, vulnerable young people are discharged from CAMHS, regardless of their mental health situation, not knowing whether they'll be considered "ill enough" by adult mental health services.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS - child and adolescent mental health services
Currently discharge their patients at 18 regardless of whether they have recovered well enough or not. 
Even if the patient is referred to adult mental health services, 9 times out of 20 they're not considered "ill enough" to get help.
It's also very unsettling for a fragile young person to have to get used to a new key worker (if they do get accepted by adult services), when they have established a good relationship with their CAMHS worker

attributes.action: Prevent drug-related overdose deaths: trial supervised drug consumption rooms
attributes.background: Supervised drug consumption facilities have been successfully operating in Europe for 30 years. They reduce the risks of disease transmission through unhygienic injecting, prevent drug-related overdose deaths & connect high-risk drug users with treatment and other health and social services.
attributes.additional_details:
Drug Consumption Rooms also seek to contribute to a reduction in drug use in public places and the presence of discarded needles and other related public order problems linked with open drug scenes. Typically, drug consumption rooms provide drug users with: sterile injecting equipment; counselling services before, during and after
drug consumption; emergency care in the event of overdose; and primary medical care and referral to appropriate social healthcare and addiction treatment services.

attributes.action: Stop insurance discrimination affecting those with pre existing medical issues
attributes.background: Our society (rightly) talks about equality and yet the Government accepts insurance companies charging people more money for taking out policies - if they have a pre existing medical condition. It's blatant prejudice and discrimination. The government must stop this insurance industry-led practice.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has said (in a letter to MP David Davies) that this is a commercial matter. Yet human rights are not a commercial matter. Life & CIC insurance is necessary for security. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights says: Article 25. (1) Everyone has the right to security in the event of unemployment, sickness, disability... in circumstances beyond his control. 'Everyone' includes people with pre existing medical conditions who cannot afford higher premiums for life/CIC insurance.

attributes.action: Require companies asking for experience to provide work experience to students
attributes.background: It is becoming harder and harder for students to get a work placement for work experience, and more and more companies are asking for experience for entry level positions. I propose that in order to ask for experience for entry level positions, you must provide it to students within reason.
attributes.additional_details:
https://talent.works/blog/2018/03/28/the-science-of-the-job-search-part-iii-61-of-entry-level-jobs-require-3-years-of-experience/ - Although this is an American article, it shows 61% of 'entry level' jobs require experience.

http://www.ukyouthparliament.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/Manifesto-2015-2016.pdf - Work Experience was one of the top four issues raised by 875,000 young people

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2014/may/23/my-son-keen-learn-struggling-find-work-experience - Old but true

attributes.action: Change the flat rate road tax for a light commercial vehicle (LCV)
attributes.background: The current fee is £250 a year when many modern engines have very good CO2 emissions, when older LCV's that spit out black smoke pay £140 a year.
attributes.additional_details: Many small business owners who need LCV's but are being kind to the environment by getting a newer more eco friendly van instead of a cheaper black smoke machine have no choice but to pay the outdated flat rate fee. It should be replaced with a variable rate which reflects emissions.

attributes.action: Give an mandatory prison sentence after a death due to physical assault
attributes.background: My father was killed by a punch to the head in 2004 and has never received justice, the man who killed him received only community service as he done a plea bargain and admitted culpable homicide. If you hit someone and kill them it should be a mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details: No one should be able to enter a plea bargain if they hit someone and the person dies as a result. We all know right from wrong and if you kill someone then justice should serve an instant prison sentence whatever your intentions. We lost my father in 2004 and all the accused got was community service. Where's the justice in that? What does that mean for my poor father who dies of a single punch to the head? He ended up brain dead because of his injury. Help me to stop this.

attributes.action: Install Traffic Lights on M1 J29 Southbound Exit Sliproad
attributes.background: Anyone who regularly commutes using Junction 29 of the M1 will know how much of a problem traffic is at peak times when trying to exit the motorway when travelling southbound.  Installing traffic lights could significantly reduce time spent in traffic and reduce the risk of collisions when exiting.
attributes.additional_details: by signing this petition hopefully we will finally have some much needed traffic lights installed.  This will reduce the amount of collisions that happen on that roundabout, the time spent sat in traffic and also the danger of queuing back onto the motorway at peak travel times.

attributes.action: Ban organised pre-election TV debates between Party Leaders
attributes.background: Pre election TV Debates between political party leaders are a distraction; they rely too heavily on personalities, not the relevant issues. ‘Accidents on the night’ can have too big an impact on election outcomes!

attributes.action: Boost UK trade and global image by inviting China and Japan to rename islands
attributes.background: Britain is a force for good in the world. Remain and Brexit voters agree that we need to show the world that we are open for business. By brokering a new name for the disputed Senkaku/Diaoyu islands in the East China Sea, the Foreign Office can highlight our shared values - and encourage trade.
attributes.additional_details: China and Japan are the second and third biggest economies in the world and are creating investment and jobs in British industry. They dispute who owns a group of islands in the East China Sea. Resolving the dispute is a matter for China and Japan, but the UK can play a valuable role by symbolically inviting the two governments to rename the islands to reflect their and our shared values - for example the Confucius Islands or the Friendship Islands. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senkaku_Islands

attributes.action: Give full time members of the armed forces a council tax exemptions
attributes.background: Service personnel who live in a property that is not on a base have to pay council tax, however many of these due to where they are based actually live in these addresses minimally. they have to pay SILCOT the armed forces equivalent of council tax, as such they effectively pay double council tax

attributes.action: Scrap QTS professional skills test for those with learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of prospective teachers wanting to teach in various subjects apply for teacher training in the U.K. As a requirement set by the government, they are required  to undertake the Numeracy and Literacy QTS Professional Skills Test.
attributes.additional_details: For many people this may not cause any issues. However,  for the prospective teachers who have a learning disability struggle to the point where passing the test is out of their reach. I and many others believe this to be discrimination against those with a disability, as they are being turned away from pursuing their teaching career through no fault of their own. Therefore, I would like to propose that those with a learning disability, be exempt from QTS Professional Skills Tests.

attributes.action: All councils should be required by law to collect waste bins once per week
attributes.background: Many councils choose to collect bins every 2 weeks. This results in bin bags being stacked up on the ground, which creates a hatchery for flies. Fly eggs become adult flies in as little as 10 days, so this collection period allows full generations to grow, transferring disease to humans.
attributes.additional_details: Flies carry bacteria that is very harmful to humans, including salmonella, typhoid, gastroenteritis, E.coli, dysentery and even tuberculosis. They can also carry viruses and even parasitic worms. They transfer these to humans by landing in dirty environments such as bins, dead animals, and animal waste, and then landing on our food and food preparation surfaces, cutlery and plates on draining boards, tap handles, etc. The transfer happens within seconds of them landing on a surface.

attributes.action: Ban discrimination in private rental sector towards people on benefits
attributes.background: It’s become increasingly difficult to find a letting agent/ landlord that will accept people on low incomes with top up benefits. The Government should have some input on this due to the lack of council properties available to those in need.
attributes.additional_details: I have been searching for a 2 bedroom property for myself and my daughter for a few months and the stumbling block is always the fact that I receive working/child tax credit and housing benefit. This in my opinion is discriminatory towards those on low incomes who need that extra help because they are not in a position to work full time.

attributes.action: Require a minimum 30 minute rest break in a 12-hour shift by law
attributes.background: You are entitled to one rest break of 20 mins if you are employed for more than six hours a day. Therefore, even on a 12-hour shift, you are only legally entitled to ONE 20 mins rest break. This Petition is asking Parliament to change the law, to require a longer break time.
attributes.additional_details:
Andrew Griffiths MP, Minister for Small Business, Consumers & Corporate Responsibility replied on 7 June 2018 to my MP's letter: 
"We keep all our employment regulations under review, including the Working Time Regulations (WTR) 1998 which contain the statutory requirements on rest breaks. 

We currently have no plans to review these provisions, the WTR represent the minimum requirements and employers are free to offer more generous terms to their workers through their employment contracts".

attributes.action: Ban Online Casinos
attributes.background: Online casinos cause misery for the user and their families and friends.This is an addictive gambling machine and not a fun way to waste peoples money. Ban all online and shop based slot machines.

attributes.action: Lower the legal driving age to 16
attributes.background: I believe that the legal driving age should be lowered to 16 in the UK just as it is in the USA, reason being that 16 year olds now have more responsibility and this would be made easier with the option to drive

attributes.action: Give Transport for London the suburban metro rail services
attributes.background: In December 2016, the Transport Secretary, Chris Grayling refused to give the Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan the Southeastern, Southern and South Western metro rail services to Transport for London which would give a better service to passengers
attributes.additional_details: Patrick McLoughlin, Grayling's predecessor came to an agreement with Boris Johnson who was Mayor of London at that time that Transport for London should take over the Southeastern, Southern and South West metro line services when their contracts ended. The efficient running of the London Overground service highlights the considerable improvements to the reliability and quality of services that could be achieved for passengers if Transport for London were allowed to run the franchises.

attributes.action: Make medical insurance compulsory for foreign nationals visiting the UK.
attributes.background: When visiting a foreign country, UK citizens are required to take out travel / medical insurance. This should be made compulsory for foreign nationals. This could save millions of pounds for the NHS.

attributes.action: Government to take back FULL control of the Rail Network, end Privatisation!
attributes.background:
In recent years, the uk Rail Network has seen reckless actions in regards to weak bids that have fallen through, clauses that have cost millions of pounds and numerous bail outs & takeovers that where unnecessary, or preventable! 

We feel it’s time the the UK regains control of its train network
attributes.additional_details:
The state of the Bidding process is flawed, calling for multiple amendments and cost franchisees and the taxpayer millions of pounds.

It seems to be that operators are more interested in making money than seeing the needs of its key objectives that involve passengers and rail infrastructure!

The state of the past and present of the East Coast Mainline, Great Western Mainline, and many other areas of UK Franchises having final warnings or ‘Bail outs’.

It’s time the UK Rail became Public again!

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: I want Government to create a law so Ayahuasca can be used legally in the UK
attributes.background:
It is a very helpful tool in allowing an individual who feels they want to explore themselves deeper and promotes healing; physically/ physchologically & spiritually. 
Ayahuasca promotes acceptance and resistance, giving power to the individual to decide, what is for them, their best way of being.
attributes.additional_details:
With facilitators supervising space, this provides a safe opportunity to experience the medicine

It is the use of Banisteriopsis caapi. 
A brew of B. caapi & P. viridis is the traditional South American brew. The caapi is particularly important as traditionally the caapi itself is considered to be “ayahuasca” while the DMT-containing plants are simply helpers.

Ayahuasca, also known as yage, is a blend of two plants - the ayahuasca vine and a shrub called chacruna (Psychotria viridis)

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for permitting assisted dying for terminally ill individuals.
attributes.background: The public opinion is in favour of allowing assisted dying for the terminally ill but the Parliament consistently opposes this.

attributes.action: Offer free life and employability skills to young offenders.
attributes.background: With the alarming increase in youth violence, it is crucial to not only prevent it spreading- but to help those already involved. A criminal record can lessen the chance of employment, and without being taught necessary skills and given support those young people may fall back into their old ways.
attributes.additional_details: Article 26 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights state that we have a right to education, and educating young offenders on ways in which they can turn their lives around and overcome all adversities is better than any national curriculum.

attributes.action: Ban the Sale of Puppies and Kittens in Pet Shops in the UK.
attributes.background: It can be hard to resist cute puppies and kittens for sale in pet-store windows. But a closer look into how these stores obtain animals reveals a system in which the high price that consumers pay for “that doggie in the window”.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a victory for the Lucy's Law campaign, which has been calling for the ban to be implemented.

The campaign was named after a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel who was badly treated in the puppy farming system.

attributes.action: Reform the sentencing laws for manslaughter and murder
attributes.background: There should be no half sentences and life should mean life for violent and serious crimes. The broad term used for manslaughter needs to be addressed and reformed, there has to be better sentencing to provide justice for the victim and their families when someone has been violently killed.
attributes.additional_details: Manslaughter ranges from one punch to someone stabbing someone who is unarmed multiple times in a sustained and brutal attack. Serving five years of ten in prison is not enough, instead of shutting prisons, there should be enough to allow violent offenders to serve a whole term sentence. Criminals these days know how to play the parole board knowing they may be able to go home halfway through their sentence even though they have taken a life. This situation does not deter violent people from carrying or arming themselves with a knife and ultimately killing someone.

attributes.action: Ban inflatable bouncy slides at private and public events
attributes.background: Our daughter, one week after her 4th birthday, broke her arm sliding down and rolling off the end of a bouncy slide. Hearing the agony she was in and the trauma she went through to get better was heartbreaking and would not want any other child to go through this preventable accident.
attributes.additional_details:
After reading news story after news story about serious accidents on bouncy slides, also hearing from friends about children hurting themselves, it seems everyone has a story of some degree about the dangers of these slides and we believe it's cause for a total ban on this equipment.

If you agree, please sign this petition and hopefully we can have this matter brought up in Parliament.

attributes.action: Make Ofsted inspections every 3 years for all schools, regardless of grading.
attributes.background: Ofsted should inspect all schools regularly, every 2/3 years, regardless of previous inspection results.
